ygData.subject: Re: Plate Pricing
ygData.msgSnippet: IMHO, 4 times. I tried 3 times and lost money on rare occasions. That was also when my smithing was just over 100, but I still think 4 times (about) is pretty
ygData.messageBody:
IMHO, 4 times. I tried 3 times and lost money on rare occasions. That was also
when my smithing was just over 100, but I still think 4 times (about) is pretty
good :) Let's not get into this whole thing again, though =P Sell for whatever
you want, my prices work for me, your prices work for you :) 4 times has kept
both me and my customers happy, so I stick with approximately that. That's my
only reasoning or backing, I will not have another flame war :)
-Rennin of E'Ci
Trade Council GM

Lemac Justerian wrote:

> From: "Lemac Justerian" <lemac@...>
>
> Plate costs should be balanced between the cost an NPC would BUY them for,
> and the cost an NPC will SELL them for... example: if the NPC will BUY that
> Breast Plate for 50 but wants to SELL it for 200, then your price could
> (should) be half way between those two - 125p - or higher... IF your costs
> don't outweigh it...
>
> In the RW, most manufacturers make an item for $1.00 in costs for both parts
> AND labor, but with overhead, middlemen and retail costs, and profits for
> each along the way, the actual PRICE of the item is usually around $9.99 or
> more... Learn from RL folks... Sure we probably couldn't sell our Banded
> for 10 times what it costs (actual) to make it, but hey, 3 times the amount
> is not that bad...
>
> Lemac Justerian - High Elf Cleric on Karana server
> Proud member of Platinum Sphere Guild - www.platinumsphere.com
>
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: Bryan G Hardy <bhardy@...>
> To: <EQ_Blacksmiths@onelist.com>
> Sent: Thursday, July 15, 1999 4:25 PM
> Subject: Re: [EQ_Blacksmiths] Plate Pricing
>
> > From: "Bryan G Hardy" <bhardy@...>
> >
> > Scaled plate should be offered at no less than half of what storebought
> > plate
> > costs. If you want to right the economy, do it with this.
> >
> > ----- Original Message -----
> > From: Nick Emmerich <seorin@...>
> > To: <EQ_Blacksmiths@onelist.com>
> > Sent: Thursday, July 15, 1999 4:14 PM
> > Subject: [EQ_Blacksmiths] Plate Pricing
> >
> >
> > > From: Nick Emmerich <seorin@...>
> > >
> > > Just want to say, when we are finally able to make plate (this isn't in
> > the near
> > > future, mind you. Tailoring is probably next to be worked on after make
> > poison,
> > > and then probably tinkering or alchemy from what I've read all around),
> we
> > > should only sell for 5 to 10 plat less than the magical plates are sold
> > for. We
> > > can't sell for NPC plate prices (people would just buy magical plate)
> but
> > I
> > > really don't want to shoot myself in the foot and have the same thing
> > happen
> > > with plate as it did to banded. Please, no flames, I know some of you
> will
> > only
> > > want 10 plat profit per piece, that's your right, and this is mine. This
> > is what
> > > I will be doing and I would hope if you're concerned over smithing,
> please
> > do
> > > the same. Plate will NOT be cheaper to make oneself (not only the 150
> plat
> > it
> > > takes to get to banded, but all the time selling banded to get to making
> > plate),
> > > so we don't have to worry about that happening. Just gotta be
> competetive
> > with
> > > magical plates. Again, please no flames, I'm terribly sick of them, and
> I
> > will
> > > not respond. Please, if you're on my side, don't respond to any flames
> > either.
> > > Let the baby have his/her bottle.
> > > -Rennin of E'Ci
> > > Trade Council GM
> > >
